document.docAuthor: Moulton, John K., Currie, Douglas C. & Craig, Douglas A.
document.docTitle: Ectemnoides Moulton & Currie & Craig 2018, n. gen.
document.masterDocTitle: A New Genus, Ectemnoides, for Seven Species of Australian Gondwanan Simuliidae (Diptera) With Description of a Novel Form of Larval Attachment

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A New Genus, Ectemnoides, for Seven Species of Australian Gondwanan Simuliidae (Diptera) With Description of a Novel Form of Larval Attachment

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Department of Entomology and Plant Pathology, The University of Tennessee, 370 Plant Biotechnology Building, Knoxville, TN 37996 - 4560,
Department of Natural History, Royal Ontario Museum, 100 Queen’s Park, Toronto, ON M 5 S 2 C 6, Canada,
Department of Biological Sciences, University of Alberta, Edmonton, AB T 6 G 2 E 9, Canada, and

subSubSection.paragraph:
In reference to behavior of a component of the genus where larvae construct and attach to a thread, reminescent of larvae of the North American genus
Ectemnia
. The gender is masculine (International Code of Zoological Nomenclature, Article 30.1.4.4).

The following described material is assigned to
Ectemnoides
n. gen. with one new combination established.

Ect. umbratorum (Tonnoir 1925)
. Type species. New combination
Ect. faecofilus
n. sp.
Larvae (larvae of Ect . sp. A, known only from partial exuviae)

paragraph.keyLead:
- Abdominal cuticle lacking hexagonal pattern, anal sclerite absent ( Fig. 121 ) ..................................
Ect. acanthocranius
; Ect. sp. A

3. Body elongated, anterior proleg markedly elongated, circlet of hooks not markedly small ( Fig. 169 ) .....................
Ect. princeae

- Body not markedly elongated, anterior proleg not markedly elongated, circlet of hooks markedly small ( Fig. 210 ) ....
Ect. absitus

4. Postgenal cleft U-shaped, extended 0.5× distance to hypostomal groove ( Fig. 37 ). Hypostoma with lateral teeth (4–8) fused basally into single structure ( Figs. 38 and 73 ) ......................... 5

- Postgenal cleft with medial projection ( Fig. 133 ), larvae not on threads ..................................................................
Ect. uvulatus

1. Gill, two main trunks with fine filaments ( Figs. 24 and 25 ), basal fenestral diverticulum present (poorly expressed in
Ect. acanthocranius
)..........................
Ect. uvulatus ...............................
2

2. Frontal plate of female, narrow, ovoid, frontal setae doubled ( Fig. 60 ) ................................
Ect. umbratorum
;
Ect. faecofilus .

- Frontal plate of female, broader, angulate, frontal setae absent ( Fig. 103 ) ...................................................
Ect. acanthocranius

- Gill, three trunks with thicker filaments, or lacking trunks ( Figs. 206 and 224 ) ...............................
Ect. absitus
; Ect. sp. A.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Adults (Adults of Ect . sp. A, and
Ect. uvulatus
are unknown)

paragraph.keyLead:
3. Calcipala small, but distinct ( Fig. 87 ) .........
Ect. acanthocranius
